conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod at the initial moment.
Conductor rod MN has an initial horizontal leftward velocity v0.
Initial kinetic energy of the rod is converted into electrical energy and dissipated as Joule heat.
Total resistance seen by the rod is R/2.
Power dissipated in the circuit is B^2L^2v^2/2R.
Power equals rate of change of kinetic energy minus work done by magnetic force.
Work done by magnetic force is change in kinetic energy over time.
At rest, kinetic energy is completely converted to heat: 1/2mv0^2 = Q.
Magnetic force on rod MN is given by FB = BIL.
Current I derived from power equation: I = sqrt(B^2v/R).
Magnetic force at initial moment: FB = sqrt(B^4L^4v0/2R).
Magnitude of Ampere force at initial moment is (B^2L^2/sqrt(Rm)) sqrt(2Q).
